FASTQ.description: A FASTQ file of a NGS experiment.

READ_LENGTH.label: Length of Reads
READ_LENGTH.description: The length of the reads in that file.

NUMBER_OF_READS.label: Number of Reads
NUMBER_OF_READS.description: Number of reads included in the file.

Q_MS_RAW_DATA.description: Designates the raw data generated during an MS run. Such data is either stored in a vendor-specific format (e.g., binary RAW files for Thermo Orbitraps) or in the open mzML standard.

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.label: Secondary name
Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_FILE_PROPERTIES.label: File properties
Q_FILE_PROPERTIES.description: A XML-based file that contains file-specific meta information (e.g., checksums for data integrity checks).

Q_MS_RAW_VENDOR_TYPE.label: MS Vendor raw format
Q_MS_RAW_VENDOR_TYPE.description: Vendor format used by this raw file. For more information see vocabulary description.

Q_MEASUREMENT_START_DATE.label: Measurement's starting date
Q_MEASUREMENT_START_DATE.description: Specifies the date/time when a measurement is started.

Q_NGS_RAW_DATA.description: Dataset holding raw data of an Next Generation Sequencing experiment

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.label: Secondary name
Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_READS_COUNT.label: Reads count
Q_READS_COUNT.description: Holds the number of reads produced by the sequencing run. This variable is intended for internal use (extracted automatically from the data file).

Q_FILE_PROPERTIES.label: File properties
Q_FILE_PROPERTIES.description: A XML-based file that contains file-specific meta information (e.g., checksums for data integrity checks).

Q_WF_MS_MAXQUANT_RESULTS.description: The result files generated by MaxQuant. Depending the operational mode of MaxQuant, the results may or may not contain protein quantification results.

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.label: Secondary name
Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_FILE_PROPERTIES.label: File properties
Q_FILE_PROPERTIES.description: A XML-based file that contains file-specific meta information (e.g., checksums for data integrity checks).

Q_WF_MS_QUALITYCONTROL_RESULTS.description: Results produced by the OpenMS QC workflow as qcML.

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.label: Secondary name
Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_WF_MS_MAXQUANT_ORIGINAL_OUT.description: This data set type holds all the files that a MaxQuant run produces, except the input raw files. Data is held inside a tar.gz.

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.label: Secondary name
Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_FILE_PROPERTIES.label: File properties
Q_FILE_PROPERTIES.description: A XML-based file that contains file-specific meta information (e.g., checksums for data integrity checks).

Q_EXT_MS_QUALITYCONTROL_RESULTS.description: Results produced by OpenMS QC as qcML.

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.label: Secondary name
Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_MA_RAW_DATA.description: Designates the raw data generated during an MicroArray run. Such data is for example stored in a vendor-specific format (e.g., CEL files).

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.label: Secondary name
Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_FILE_PROPERTIES.label: File properties
Q_FILE_PROPERTIES.description: A XML-based file that contains file-specific meta information (e.g., checksums for data integrity checks).

Q_EXTERNALDB_ID.label: External DB identifier
Q_EXTERNALDB_ID.description: This field facilitates the cross-linking to external databases outside the QBiC (e.g., confidential patient databases).

Q_PROJECT_DATA.description: Datasets that are attached to an instance of Q_Attachment_Sample and should be presented to the user on the project level. This should only include datasets that are not specific workflow results.

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.label: Secondary name
Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_ATTACHMENT_TYPE.label: Attachment Type
Q_ATTACHMENT_TYPE.description: Type of the attached file, e.g. results or experiment information. Used in the navigator to show the respective data sets where they are expected by the user.

Q_MS_MZML_DATA.description: Raw microspectrometry data that has been converted to mzML format.

Q_FILE_PROPERTIES.label: File properties
Q_FILE_PROPERTIES.description: A XML-based file that contains file-specific meta information (e.g., checksums for data integrity checks).

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.label: Secondary name
Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_MEASUREMENT_START_DATE.label: Measurement's starting date
Q_MEASUREMENT_START_DATE.description: Specifies the date/time when a measurement is started.

Q_WF_MA_QUALITYCONTROL_LOGS.description: Log files of a microarray quality control run.

Q_WF_MA_QUALITYCONTROL_RESULTS.description: Results of a microarray quality control run.

Q_WF_MS_MAXQUANT_LOGS.description: Log files of a maxquant run.

Q_WF_MS_PEPTIDEID_LOGS.description: Log files created by the Peptide Identification Workflow run

Q_WF_MS_PEPTIDEID_RESULTS.description: Results produced by the Peptide Identification Workflow

Q_WF_MS_QUALITYCONTROL_LOGS.description: Log files produced by the OpenMS QC workflow.

Q_WF_NGS_EPITOPE_PREDICTION_LOGS.description: Logs of a peptide prediction workflow run. Peptides are analyzed with respect to MHC binding for a specific set of MHC alleles.

Q_WF_NGS_EPITOPE_PREDICTION_RESULTS.description: Results of a peptide prediction workflow run. Peptides are analyzed with respect to MHC binding for a specific set of MHC alleles.

Q_WF_NGS_HLATYPING_LOGS.description: Logs of an HLA typing workflow run. The prediction of HLA alleles is based on WGS/WES or RNA-Seq data.

Q_WF_NGS_HLATYPING_RESULTS.description: Results of an HLA typing workflow run. The prediction of HLA alleles is based on WGS/WES or RNA-Seq data. Results contain the predicted six HLA alleles and a coverage plot.

Q_WF_NGS_MAPPING_LOGS.description: Logs of an NGS read mapping workflow run. Reads are aligned to the selected reference genome.

Q_NGS_IONTORRENT_DATA.description: Torrent Suite data folder packaged as tar. This data folder is intended to be re-imported to the Torrent Suite cloud solution at Pathology if needed. VCF/XLS files are stored separately (as children).

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.label: Secondary name
Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_PGM_TOTAL_SAMPLES.label: PGM total number of samples
Q_PGM_TOTAL_SAMPLES.description: An Ion Torrent PGM measurement usually processes several samples simultaneously. This property keeps track of the number of these.

Q_TARBALL_SHA256SUM.label: Tarball sha256 checksum
Q_TARBALL_SHA256SUM.description: Complex multi-file datasets might be packaged as a single tarball. In this case, this field contains the tarball's checksum.

Q_WF_NGS_MAPPING_RESULTS.description: Results of an NGS read mapping workflow run. Reads are aligned to the selected reference genome. The results contain the generated BAM file.

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.label: Secondary name
Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_WF_NGS_QUALITYCONTROL_LOGS.description: Logs of a FastQC workflow run.

Q_WF_NGS_QUALITYCONTROL_RESULTS.description: Results of a FastQC workflow run.

Q_WF_NGS_RNAEXPRESSIONANALYSIS_LOGS.description: Logs of an RNA expression analysis workflow run. RNA reads are mapped to the corresponding reference and feature counts are generated.

Q_WF_NGS_RNAEXPRESSIONANALYSIS_RESULTS.description: Results of an RNA expression analysis workflow run. RNA reads are mapped to the corresponding reference and feature counts are generated.

Q_WF_NGS_VARIANT_ANNOTATION_LOGS.description: Logs of a variant annotation run. Provided variants in VCF format are annotated using the respective variant annotation software based on the selected reference genome.

Q_WF_NGS_VARIANT_ANNOTATION_RESULTS.description: Results of a variant annotation run. Provided variants in VCF format are annotated using the respective variant annotation software based on the selected reference genome.

Q_WF_NGS_VARIANT_CALLING_LOGS.description: Logs of a variant calling workflow run.

Q_WF_NGS_VARIANT_CALLING_RESULTS.description: Results of a variant calling workflow run. Variants are called based on provided NGS reads. Variants (not annotated) are provided as VCF file.

Q_NGS_READ_MATCH_ARCHIVE.description: Files ending in .rma are in a compressed binary format called RMA (read-match archive) produced by MALT (MEGAN alignment tool). There are multiple versions, e.g. RMA2, RMA3, RMA6

Q_READ_MATCH_ARCHIVE_FORMAT.label: Read match archive format
Q_READ_MATCH_ARCHIVE_FORMAT.description: Version of the red match archive format produced by MALT (MEGAN alignment tool) or similar tools

Q_WF_NGS_SHRNA_COUNTING_RESULTS.description: Results of a shRNA counting workflow run. Given a set of reads from shRNA sequencing, we count how often each reference shRNA sequence occurs at the expected position in the reads. Each read should contain a barcode at a specified position. We divide the reads according to those barcodes.

Q_WF_NGS_SHRNA_COUNTING_LOGS.description: Logs of a shRNA counting workflow run.

Q_BMI_IMAGING_DATA.description: Imaging data (set of DICOM files) packaged as tarball. This tarball comprises all imaging sequences (could be modeled separately in the future).

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.label: Secondary name
Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_EXTERNALDB_ID.label: External DB identifier
Q_EXTERNALDB_ID.description: This field facilitates the cross-linking to external databases outside the QBiC (e.g., confidential patient databases).

Q_TARBALL_SHA256SUM.label: Tarball sha256 checksum
Q_TARBALL_SHA256SUM.description: Complex multi-file datasets might be packaged as a single tarball. In this case, this field contains the tarball's checksum.

Q_WF_MS_PEAKPICKING_LOGS.description: Peak Picking of one or more mzml files done using openMS.

Q_VACCINE_CONSTRUCT_DATA.description: Dataset to hold vaccine construct data such as the list of selected epitopes

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.label: Secondary name
Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_FASTA_DATA.description: Dataset holding fasta file which can contain protein sequences or nucleotide sequences.

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.label: Secondary name
Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.label: Secondary name
Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_FILE_PROPERTIES.label: File properties
Q_FILE_PROPERTIES.description: A XML-based file that contains file-specific meta information (e.g., checksums for data integrity checks).

Q_EXTERNALDB_ID.label: External DB identifier
Q_EXTERNALDB_ID.description: This field facilitates the cross-linking to external databases outside the QBiC (e.g., confidential patient databases).

Q_NGS_MTB_DATA.description: Variant information and diagnosis data for the molecular tumor board.

Q_NMR_RAW_DATA.description: Data set for NMR measurements raw data.

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.label: Secondary name
Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_PEPTIDE_DATA.description:
Dataset to hold peptide data stored in different file formats. 
Peptide data may be stored as fasta file, simple peptide list or 
a tab-separated file with an identifier and a sequence column e.g..

EXPRESSION_MATRIX.description: Contains a CSV file measuring expression of some kind (genes, proteins). It should contain references to IDs used in openbis or the experimental design.

Q_HT_QPCR_DATA.description: Data of a high-throughput qPCR run

Q_MA_CHIP_IMAGE.description: Images or Pseudo-images of microarray chips. Can for example be used for quality control.

Q_TEST.description: this is just for quick testing

Q_NGS_VARIANT_CALLING_DATA.description: Dataset holding data of a variant calling experiment

Q_NGS_IMMUNE_MONITORING_DATA.description: Dataset holding data of an immune monitoring experiment

ARR.description: The ARR file contains any sample attributes and array information of an affymetrix microarray.

Q_MTB_ARCHIVE.description: A ZIP file containing the reported somatic and germline SNVs and CNVs, plus the additional diagnosis. The content are 6 tab-separated files, following the specification with CeGaT, IMGAG and ZPM. This is the information that gets redirected to the CentraXX system and is stored here as additional backup.

AUDIT.description:
An Audit file is an XML file that tracks the processing of each physical array processed by AGCC. An
Audit file is produced for each physical array and tracks all the processing steps that were performed on the array, including multiple scannings and regridding. The audit file has the same root name as the physical array.

CEL.description: Affymetrix CEL format raw file. The CEL file stores the results of the intensity calculations on the pixel values of the DAT file. This includes an intensity value, standard deviation of the intensity, the number of pixels used to calculate the intensity value, a flag to indicate an outlier as calculated by the algorithm and a user defined flag indicating the feature should be excluded from future analysis. This data is used by the CHP writer software to extract the actual data of interest.

Q_DOCUMENT.description: A document file carrying metainformation about one or more samples or sample sources

Q_NGS_HLATYPING_DATA.description: Dataset holding data of an HLA Typing experiment

EXPERIMENTAL_DESIGN.description: Contains TSV of the experimental design format used by the wizard. To be attached to single experimental layers, namely the ones containing data to be analyzed with respect to the experimental design.

MZML.description: Mass spectrometry data format. Unifiying mzXML and mzData formats, as released at the 2008 American Society for Mass Spectrometry Meeting.
